p: The output charge was 9.4 × 10 −13 C under 1000× g static acceleration signal action and 4.8 × 10 −12 C under 5000× g static acceleration. In general, the output increased with the acceleration signal increase. For the same acceleration amplitude, the output charge of the dynamic load was generally larger than that of the static load. For example, the output charge was 9.4 × 10 −13 C under 1000× g static acceleration signal action, while that of 1000× g dynamic acceleration signal action was 9.6 × 10 −13 C. Actually, the quartz crystal of piezoelectric pressure sensor was usually thicker than the ANSYS model, which produced a more significant acceleration-induced effect.
